title: Trump-Colombia tensions thaw after months of heated exchanges
subhead: After threatening and insulting Colombian leader Gustavo Petro, the US president unexpectedly invited him to the White House.

title: 'Nero at the Elysée': A story of hope dashed by Macron's presidency
Iran protests swell nationwide as crackdown intensifies and internet is cut
Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland
subhead: If Europeans allow the US to take control of Greenland, NATO would cease to be an alliance and the European Union would become a protectorate, a group of researchers argues in this op-ed for Le Monde.

title: Israeli government accelerates settlement expansion in occupied West Bank
subhead: With tenders for 9,600 housing units for Jewish families in the occupied West Bank, 2025 set a record, with an openly stated goal of delivering 'a fatal blow to the idea of a Palestinian state.'

title: France enjoys another banner year for tourism, buoyed by campgrounds and international visitors
subhead: International tourism revenue rose by 9% in France in 2025, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organization.

title: China's Pingtan Island reflects rising tensions in the Taiwan Strait
subhead: On Pingtan Island, China's closest point to Taiwan, repeated Chinese military maneuvers are exasperating fishers and fueling 'reunification' tourism.

title: Venezuela announces large-scale prisoner release
Take Trump seriously on Greenland, Vance warns Europe
US strengthens grip on Venezuela by seizing two oil tankers, including one flying the Russian flag
UN says the US has 'legal obligation' to fund agencies after Trump withdraws from several
Macron says US is 'turning away' from allies
Protesters clash with police in Minneapolis after ICE officer kills woman
France will vote against EU-Mercosur trade deal, Macron says
France seeks to assert role in Caribbean after Trump's show of force
EU-Mercosur deal set to be signed, with or without France's support
Syria: New clashes between government forces and Kurds signal failure of negotiations
Paris incinerator extension drives up costs and raises health concerns
Eating too many preservatives could increase cancer and diabetes risks
'If Doctors Without Borders were to cease activities in Gaza, the impact would be absolutely enormous'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Filipe Ribeiro, head of mission for Doctors Without Borders in Jerusalem, responds to the Israeli government's decision to ban it and 36 other non-governmental organizations from operating in the occupied Palestinian territories.

title: French judges alarmed by rumors of US sanctioning magistrates who sentenced Le Pen
subhead: Peimane Ghaleh-Marzban, the president of the Paris judicial court, spoke out to condemn what he called 'unacceptable interference.' His remarks followed revelations in the German press about the possibility that the United States might sanction the French judges who sentenced Marine Le Pen.

title: Gaza's grandparents, shattered pillars of a traumatized society
subhead: Elderly people, whose health is often fragile and mobility reduced, feel as if they are reliving the tragedy of the Nakba, the forced exodus of Palestinians during the creation of Israel in 1948.

title: Doctors' strike is a warning sign for French healthcare
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
Maduro abduction: 'There is a tragic irony in seeing Trump cast himself as Venezuela's liberator'
